name: amazon-ecs-cli
description: CLI for Amazon ECS to manage clusters and tasks for development

repo.name: amazon-ecs-cli
repo.description: The Amazon ECS CLI enables users to run their applications on ECS/Fargate using the Docker Compose file format, quickly provision resources, push/pull images in ECR, and monitor running applications on ECS/Fargate.

readme.summary: Comprehensive documentation with excellent installation instructions but lacks a quick, working example at the top to demonstrate basic usage immediately.
readme.top_issue: No quick start example in the first 30 seconds of reading - the README jumps from concept explanation to installation without showing a simple 'hello world' usage pattern upfront.

injection_risks.description: The 'strings.Split' function is used with user input, which could lead to potential injection risks if not properly sanitized.
The 'aws.StringSlice' function is used with user input, which could lead to potential injection risks if not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Potential injection risks due to unsanitized user input.
Lack of proper input validation for container instance identifiers and cluster names.
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of proper input validation, but does not appear to have any critical vulnerabilities that would allow for unauthorized access or data breaches.

common_complaints: Project appears to be sunsetting in favor of ECS Copilot with significant feature gaps
Multiple long-standing bugs unfixed (user-data newline, ARN format support, target group caching)
Feature requests go unanswered for years (dry-run, execute-command support, file copying)
Breaking changes with newer AWS infrastructure (Cloud-init incompatibility)
sentiment.summary: amazon-ecs-cli shows clear signs of abandonment with a 2021 sunsetting question unanswered, numerous open bugs dating back to 2015-2024 receiving no attention, and feature requests languishing for years while the project is implicitly deprecated in favor of AWS Copilot.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear, helpful, and patient. They encourage contributions and provide useful technical details.

concerns: No closed issues in past 6 months despite 148 open issues
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
Large backlog of unresolved issues with no activity
maintenance.summary: amazon-ecs-cli is abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months and a substantial unaddressed issue backlog.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-organized and clear, with breaking changes marked. However, it lacks migration guides.

governance.summary: The documentation lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, indicating high bus factor risk.

project_metrics.description: The Amazon ECS CLI enables users to run their applications on ECS/Fargate using the Docker Compose file format, quickly provision resources, push/pull images in ECR, and monitor running applications on ECS/Fargate.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is thorough but lacks a clear and concise quick start guide, making it difficult for new users to get started quickly.
concerns: No merged PRs in the past six months
Last release was over two years ago
Docs: Lack of a prominent quick start section with basic usage examples
Community: Docker volumes are not permanent
Community: ECS-CLI remembers old Target group ARN, refuses to take the new TG ARN
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
Security: Potential injection risks due to unsanitized user input.
Security: Lack of proper input validation for container instance identifiers and cluster names.
highlights: Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
